text: <@U06BTNG2F8E> do you think it would be possible via workflow?
Hey Thomas, did you add it to the details template (as described on that page)?

Hi! Anybody have a sample code for associating a contact to a custom record _in sandbox_? This exact code copy-pasted works perfectly fine in our production account, but in sandbox we get a response that vaguely says: {"status":"error","message":"There was a problem with the request.","correlationId":"zzzzz-zzzz-zzzz-zzzzzz"}'.
Looks like you're hard coding the contact and custom object ids, which will be different depending on which account you're using
So you'll need to use input fields
the private app token, "HubSpot_API_KEY" in your code will also be different depending on which account you're using
Yeah, I did replace these values from prod to sandbox.
My "real" code pulls these dynamically, this is my simplified example :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi. I have the data in Postman, but shouldnt it just show up as the token can not be added. Does it show for you? Well, I did work with Markdown then and my timeline events look pretty structured now.

Hello! I created a Discount object through the API. I re-use this Discount object and associate it with Quote created through the API. However, it seems like it disappeared? Its been a while since I used that Discount object and now when I do a GET request using its record ID, it says no object found. Do Discount objects have an expiration date?
